required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post Market Study to Collect Data for Software Recognizing the Anatomical Structures During Bronchoscopy.
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Post Market Study to Collect Data for Software Recognizing the Anatomical Structures as Well as Abnormalities in the Lung During a Bronchoscopy.

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim is to develop a software algorithm that has the capacity to detect the normal 18 anatomical structures of the lung by using the position of the scope during the bronchoscopy procedure and using existing bronchoscopy technology.

detailed_description.textblock:
2.000 subjects, preferable 150-200 number of patients per site. The 2.000 videos will be divided into an 80%/20% split (training and testing). It is a wish to obtain a spread of videos coming from across Europe, preferable from Germany, France and Denmark, with up to 800 videos coming from Denmark
The patient population indicated are patients indicated for full airway bronchoscopy. Of this group it is the aim to enrol the following:
1. Patients with obstructing tumors (when tumor blocks the view of the camera) - no more than 5% (120 patients) of studies
2. Bronchoscopies on indication of haemoptysis (active bleeding) - no more than 5% (120 patients) of studies
3. Patients with stents or valves - no more than 5% (120 patients) of studies bronchoscopies.
4. Patients with former lung operations, partial or full resections - no more than 2% (48 patients).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of anatomical segments accessed during bronchoscopy
primary_outcome.description: accurate photo documentation of all 18 anatomical segments +/- abnormalities

secondary_outcome.description: Identified anatomical segments by the core lab/ Identified anatomical segments by the Machine Learning (after training, using the test videos).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of total number of lesions detected
secondary_outcome.description: total lesions detected by the core lab/ total lesions detected by Machine Learning (after training, using the test videos).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of sections and lesions detected by core lab and machine learning
secondary_outcome.description: Anatomical sections + lesions detected by core lab versus anatomical sections + lesions detected by machine learning

arm_group.description: Any subject who is scheduled to undergo bronchoscopy as per routine clinical practice

intervention.description: All subjects who are scheduled for a bronchoscopy may be eligible.

study_pop.textblock: The bronchoscope is used to confirm or exclude a diagnosis in adult patients with airway complaints to identify a potential disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Oral and written participant information has been given (NA for Denmark)
2. The subject has signed informed consent (NA for Denmark)
3. Patients indicated for full airway bronchoscopy (identifying all 18 anatomical segments)
4. Patients older than 18
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject with serious lung disease which investigator considers not appropriate for this examination.
2. Lack of patient cooperation for bronchoscopy (patient with mental disorders, dysgnosia, psychological disorderâ€¦)
3. Subjects unable to give consent (NA for Denmark)

patient_data.ipd_description: Provide data to Ambu A/S that can not be identified without the identification log.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: restricted access with user accounts to electronic data capture system
